alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:33AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern St. Lawrence County through 630 AM EDT... At 533 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Fowler, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oswegatchie, Fowler, Degrasse, Cranberry Lake, Star Lake, Fine, Pitcairn, Edwards, Lower Oswegatchie, Aldrich, Talcville, Wanakena, South Edwards, Fullerville, Newton Falls, Balmat, and West Fowler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
